Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2012 11:36AM SpiceGirl wrote: Hi, Aic ~ I completely understand how you feel.  After several mammograms and MRIs, starting October 2011, through February 2012, I had gone for a PET scan on Feb 3, 2012, just to confirm the spead of my diagnosed IIB cancer in my left breast, and was back to see the surgeon when she asked me if anyone had gone over my scan with me yet.  Um, no, that was her job?  Well, long story short, I went straight from a lump in my left breast to mets in my liver and bones, Stage IV right off the bat.  I'm ER+/PR+/HER2-, so after "very aggressive chemo" (apparently my cancer was "very aggressive" also), I've been on Arimidex (generic Anastazole) and Zometa treatment for my bones, and so far, so good.  The bones have stabilized, one of my liver tumors has actually shrunk, and there doesn't seem to be any sign of the cancer in my breast and the lymph nodes around it at all.  I'm 59 years old, so I guess this is kind of an unusual response for someone my age; from what I can read in the literature I guess us older women don't respond as well to treatment, but I'm planning on kicking it as long as I can.  Hang in there - and wow, I'm glad I found this forum myself.  Stage IV is scary - nice to be able to "talk" to others who know what you're saying. Cinnamon Dx 2/7/12, Stave IV, Mets liver, bones; ER+/PR+/HER2-
Posts.Title: Petrified...Stage IV with mets to the liver right out the gate aic GatorGal
